{{codepointer|Sound}}'''A_FLoopActiveSound'''
(no parameters)
==Usage== Plays the actor's {{property|ActiveSound}}, if one is defined. The sound is only played if the current tic is evenly divisible by eight. Contrary to what the name of this function implies, the sound is ''not'' looped. The only standard class that uses this function is {{class|WaterDropOnFloor}}, which uses it to make the sound slightly less repetitive.
For general sound playback, you probably want to use [[A_PlaySound]] instead.
== Examples == This is from the {{class|WaterDropOnFloor}} actor that uses this sound. Spawn: DRIP A 6 '''A_FLoopActiveSound''' DRIP BC 4 DRIP D 4 '''A_FLoopActiveSound''' DRIP EF 4 DRIP G 4 '''A_FLoopActiveSound''' DRIP H 4 Loop
